description: The image presents a stark contrast between a figure performing the mundane task of watering a tiny patch of ground and a surreal landscape where household furniture, including a dresser and armchair, is being swept away by a flood. The large, disproportionate size and odd form of the figure, along with her intense focus on the trivial watering, highlight the absurdity of the scene. This juxtaposition creates an ironic commentary on human attention to minor details while oblivious to larger, catastrophic events nearby. The environment features a small, cultivated mound overlooking a destructive waterway carrying domestic objects, emphasizing the disconnect and surreal nature of the setting.
